Reviews.Title: “hotel is fine, location is not”
Reviews.Author: KellyMath22
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good, nothing amazing but not bad. Staff was nice and helpful. The restaurant was good but expensive. Breakfast was provided free each morning and there was a good variety. To actually get into the center of Rome is a bit of a trek. The nearest train station is Tiburtina. When looking at a map it seemed like it wasn't too far of a walk but as two young women we really didn't feel safe the moment we stepped out of our hotel onto the street. We opted for taking the bus to Tiburtina as the bus station was right across (a pretty busy and hard to cross) street. The bus was packed full but it was an okay way to get there. If you want to feel a bit safer and closer to the action I don't recommend staying here. If you're okay with have to take a little transportation and want the cheaper price its okay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: JessRod
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Italy and in one week we saw VENICE, ROME, PISA, and a few other places. Rome was by far the hardest to get around in. We had a rental car and given that I do not like public transportation, this was the best way to get around in Rome since it is way cheaper and Rome is known for it's insane traffic. We were stuck in the bus on the way back from the Colosseum for about 2 hours, in very tricky traffic had we driven. This HOTEL was perfect, the bus stop is right across the street to go out and two steps away on the way back. The hotel is in a non busy street. I love the layout and location. The staff was nice and ensured we had a map that we understood and also gave us directions to using the subways and how to come back and such. They speak almost every language which is awesome, we would try spanish and french aside from english, they knew it all. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are very cosy. I would highly recommend anyone to stay here, Perfect location. I will say, there where no restaurants around if you wanted to walk but then again we ate dinner in the hotel and very much enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff (Antonio & Mr. Cafe are the best!) and perfect location. We've found a home.”
Reviews.Author: Italianmocha
Reviews.Content: My husband is Italian and we live in the States. I've never been to Italy before and it was a very nice experience. He speak fluent Italian and I don't at all except si,no and ciao so that part was irritating a little bit to not understand but the language of friendliness and great customer service is universal! We were there on a family/business trip so there was no need to pay for a high end hotel/resort if we where going to be so busy. At the end of each or beginning of the morning we came across the sweetest and most helpful staff. Antonio at the front desk was exceptionally helpful. We told him that he is not allowed to have another day off or weekend off until we leave....haha. The moment we arrived he gave us a map and told us how to get around. We also had questions about some addresses we needed to go to and he ran a couple of searches us and offered to call if we needed him to. That made us feel welcomed and at home. There was another guy that was there whose name we can't remember but you will know exactly who he is because he is everywhere doing everything. From serving coffee at the bar to helping in the breakfast area to being a waiter in the restaurant. We called him "Mr. Cafe" because every time he saw my husband he asked him if he wanted an expresso. Even if he saw him 12 times for the day. It was not pressuring but i think he know that it was hilarious as we would always laugh but sometimes take him up on his offer...hahaha. The other staff members were awesome too but these too made it exceptional. The location of the hotel is Ideal. It is about 4 blocks from the Metro station and the bus terminal (which meet up at the same spot) so we could hop on to a bus across the street from the hotel (as there is a bus stop right there) and the bus takes you to the bus terminal/metro station. After that, it's where ever you want to go. At the end of the day, we took the blue line metro to Tiburtina station then waited at the bus terminal (which was right there) and took the 409 which stops right in front of the hotel as there is a bus stop right at the entrance of the hotel. It was perfect so we didn't have to rent a car or anything. We were lucky to find this hotel and when we go back to Rome next year and there after we will never be going anywhere else. Thank you Blu!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place with friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TOAGOGO
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Rome with my two sons 13 & 15 for a vacation. From Da Vinci went upstairs and caught a train to Tibertina which is only a ten minute walk, 10 euro cab ride or a 1 euro bus (409 ) which is across the street from the station right to the hotel. At the hotel me met Antonio who was incredibly helpful in perfect english. He gave us a map pointing out the best routes to see the incrdible sites and where to avoid. In fact, all the staff were very friendly with the front desk all speaking english and always sparing their time to answer a question. The room was ready at 1 and always made when we got back for a pitstop before going back out for dinner.Big fresh towels and the room was always clean. We would be down at the Collisium and not think twice about going back to the hotel to refresh and come right back down. It really is not far as some people express in this forum. AC/ Toilet/ lights/ safe, all worked and the hotel was quite and you could not here outside noise. They are planning to put in a pool in a couple years with in my opinion would make it a 4.5 star and an incredible place to stay. If I go back to Rome I would without question go back to this hotel! Special thanks to Antonio for keeping me somewhat calm when I was pick-pocketed on the Metro. Hold on to your wallets. The Metro in very busy at rush times. It makes other transit systems look empty in comparision.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: rays32999
Reviews.Content: The hotel and services were excellent. We did not speak italian but they were very accomodative. They understood us and served well. We liked the attached restaurant also.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough hotel near Tiburtina staion.”
Reviews.Author: Mikenmar22000
Reviews.Content: We booked here as a place to crash before an early train to Naples from Tiburtina. Check-in was efficient. The room was good, but nothing spectacular in terms of ambience. It was clean and well-maintained. The neighborhood is a bit lacking for nightlife and as you get closer to the train station looks a little sketchy(not dangerous but not appealing either). Checkout was fast and smooth. My best advice to the hotel is that you don't have to push the restaurant every single time someone comes to the desk. It gets annoying after 3-4 times in a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, free parking and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Drew Jones
Reviews.Content: Great service, free parking and helpful staff I spent three nights here while getting new passports, I had not intended to go to Rome but one needs a passport to travel. I booked the hotel based on the reviews, parking and ease of location - I had a pleasant surprise on arrival. The room was of a good size with a large terrace and the staff were amazing. I had contacted the hotel prior to arrival as my replacement (the originals Stolen from the car near Torino along with passports, camera etc) credit cards were being sent there (as were my travel companions), I received a prompt reply - so a good start. Once the deliveries arrived we were notified immediately - again I was pleased with the service. The staff assisted us in every way they could, photocopies, calling cabs, informing if a places to eat, the bus stop to get to the station, where we could get a tyre fixed - the list goes on as did their assistance - I was more than impressed. We had no air-conditioning on the first night, but it was not too hot, the second night we had partial air and the third night it was all working, I have no issue with things not working all the time, providing something is been done about it - again I was impressed. If I was to fault them, it would be that when we got a glass of ice, the glass was out in the ice bucket - this should not be done - if the glass breaks you have to throw out the ice - a minor detail. We had a great stay and cannot thank the staff enough for their assistance.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix057
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, sheets & towels were changed daily, a simple luxury we appreciated very much. Found no tea/coffee making facilities but this was soon rectified with one call to the reception. The hotel is a fair walk from the station but we didn't mind walking even after 10.00pm, there are 2 buses that would take you to the Metro station, all attractions are a short train ride away. We found the staff to be friendly & rooms clean. A variety of foods were offered at breakfast on each day. We dined at the hotel restaurant on our final night & enjoyed southern Italian cuisine with local wine. We will definitely stay at the Blu Hotel Roma on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I won't recommend it....”
Reviews.Author: borneo_trek
Reviews.Content: Location: If you work in London and use to rush hour walking speed its will take you 18 minutes from the main Metro (Tiburtina) If you from America more likely you have big bags or maybe fews...this could be 45 minutes...dragging...Bus no:409 and 545 fromTiburtina bus station stop about 300 meters from the hotel.Bus journey 5 minutes!.No way this hotel 700 meter from the main station (Tiburtina) If you bought a 3 days Metro travel pass you can use it on these bus. Room: Very clean because everything is new,No carpets in room but tiles! so very noisy (especially at night) This is not sound proof room so you can hear next door...pretty much everything! bad room noise insolation + 2 single bed on tiles = 3 nights no sleep. Breakfast:Coffee machine is great (free) but service with fuss!..eatable choice. I don't felt welcome in the reception...again maybe because service with fuss... Out to the right from the hotel about 4 minutes you find a pub and a kebab shop (highly recommend) and another 5 minutes you will find a little shopping mall with hypermarket. I spend 0.45 euro for 1L mineral water and its 2.50 euro for 500ML at the hotel minibar. Free Internet only for business guest :-) but their have a PC at the lobby FOC and you can print your boarding pass there too. The area is not pose at all so its good in summer but I won't dare to walk it at night especially in winter where day light shorter. For what we experienced put another 10 - 15 euro on your budget a day will diffidently make it worth it to stay in Rome city center. I feel we spend at least 2 hrs in a day traveling to Rome and with the surroundings I don't risk go on metro to Tiburtina after 10pm....so for many reason I won't recommend it...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angella_d
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is 3 bus stops away from the Tiburtina Station. From Tiburtina Station you get the train which goes directly to the airport so there is no need to go to Termini Station for the airport train. You get the bus 409 outside of the Tiburtina station and in no time you're at the hotel. A few vagrants hanging around the train station at times. The staff was helpful and friendly. There are free maps at the reception and metro/bus tickets are also sold at the reception. The room was typical best western standard featuring comfy beds, adequate closet space, mini bar, safe, cnn and bbc world on cable, free wifi, lovely bright modern bathroom, shower caps, bath gel, shampoo, soap, fresh towels. There was a computer in the lobby and printer. We never ate at the restaurant, so cant say what the food is like. Only a few persons seemed to dine there. We found an excellent little pizzeria near to the roundabout, that sold delicious pizza to order and other tasty pasta dishes and salads for very reasonable prices. There was always a take-away line outside and locals loved it. There is an Auchan supermarket abt 7mins walk from the hotel. We stocked up on water there. Breakfast at the hotel was very good for us and worth the price. It was buffet with: bacon, ham, scrambled and bolied eggs, salami, cheeses, regular and wholewheat croissants, sausages, whole wheat bread, white bread, toasting facilites, selection of juices and hot beverages, milk; yougurt, water, selection of fresh fruit, freshly baked lemon cake and marble cake, biscuits, crackers, jams, prunes, tarts, fresh vegetables.... if you're a breakfast person then it's definitely worth the money. The hotel has complimentary services which you can request e.g. a clothes iron, ice, kettle. The walls in the room are a bit thin but nothing to complain bitterly about. We had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not the best..”
Reviews.Author: drift_away_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Positive: It is clean and cheap. It is a good choice if you are not going to spend any time in the hotel.. Negative: Thin walls (can hear from the room next door - TV and people speaking), Staff are okay.. not very helpful, room service is bad... we had to call thrice for some milk for our coffee.. which ultimately did not get delivered. They said they did not have anyone to send it up to the room. Location is not too bad, a train and bus ride away from city centre. Tis is not a four star hotel.. 3 star at best

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff !”
Reviews.Author: bbvsalon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Rome on a regular basis and we have selected the Blu Hotel as our hotel of choice becuase of the great service, facilities and staff. We recently visited to celebrate my father in law's 80th birthday. We needed to host a suprise party for all of our family who reside in Rome and were concerned about how, where and the quality of the food as they are Roman residents. We choose to have the party at the hotel. The staff was great! They decorated the dining room, the food was exceptional and the service was first rate. The hotel staff has always been very helpful and professional. Most are able to speak fluent English and treat us like family. The hotel is relatively new and very modern for Rome. The rooms are larger than most you would find in Italy and they include a patio. The hotel is off the beaten path of the tourist locations, but it is very nice to stay in a neighborhood and get a feel for the Roman people outside the tourist locations. The bus stop is close by, taking you to the train station and a short ride for any sight seeing. You can get to the Vatican, Trevi or where every you want in 15 minutes. The staff will help you find your way around, so if you want a better perspective on Rome away from the typical hustle bustle this is definately the place to stay. I have nothing but positive things to say about this hotel or the staff. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Around the (clock) watch"”
Reviews.Author: Magiasmog
Reviews.Content: We spent a longer weekend over New year's in Rome.Arriving from three different locations at three different times none of the three of uns managed to find to the hotel by their description. The hotel had the room ready as asked inadvance to chek in at an earlier time, which remained the only positive aspect for the next three days. The first night we asked to move the room because an ever ongoing water tank appearantly filled up outside the window, the moved us to another room, which was quiet that night but noisy the other two as a disco or music bar is just opposite the parking lot which the room faced. Rooms were medium size , so were the bathrooms while I alwasy wonder what the liquids inside the shampoo and gel bottles are and why hotels that claim to be four stars do not resort to minis of some brands. My blanket (forget about a fluffy quilt, no it had only sheet and blanket) was completely filthy and full of stains the origins of which I would not even like to know. I reported to reception who admitted to the poor quality of the blanket only after the room service must have been thorugh with their tour not having noticed that this blanket was an absolute no-go. Having moved to another room the first morning my sister immediately noticed that her wtch was forgotten in the other (first) room which she reported to reception. As no response came from their side despite a promise to immediately follow up we kept nagging every time we passed by only to the effect that we got differing answers any time we asked, contradictory and illogical as time moved on, like "yes I have spoken in person to the maid who dod the room, no she has not found the watch", no I havent spoken to that maid but to our best maid, no the watch is not in the room, "yes we entered the room (where by now other people were sleeping 2 and there ist was", no the watch was on the maid's trolley to who I spoke on the mobile", no "I spoke to the maid that was here 4 years and already wih the other owners" culminating in the essence that" the watch is back doenst matter where it came from". I cant help it but I would have felt better to know they did not have a problem managing their staff the way they obviously do. Breakfast only standadr, loud and quite cool brakfast room, standard choice .O.K.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Far from the Center”
Reviews.Author: Erickrop
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great as far as sevice, cleanliness and breakfast. It is a bit far from the center. You have to take one bus plus the metro to get anywhere. Rooms are modern and clean. The staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: MRU_Traveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is good (the rooms were clean and decent lobby etc). We knew the hotel was not in the centre, and didn't mind having a short bus ride from Tiburtina (3 stops). Except Saturday night, which on returning from a day in Rome at Tiburtina, found out that the bus that goes past the hotel was some sort of 'party' bus for teenagers going out, so it was rammed full of drunk 15 year olds. Not sure if this happens every weekend or it was a one-off. I suspect it's every weekend. But the REAL gripe was when we asked the night before, to have a taxi quite early at 5am to get to Tiburtina (bus doesn't run that early on Sunday) as we had an early flight. The receptionist said point-blank, no, that he would get in trouble for ordering a taxi to Tiburtina because it is such a short distance, a 5 minute walk (actually it is a 20 minute walk). He basically laughed and said we can walk it. It was really unbelievable. So we had to walk at 4:30am, in the dark, along the side of the road (pavement stops and starts) with luggage. Nice. Lucky it wasn't raining and that there were two of us, I would not have liked to walk to Tiburtina on my own during in the dark. Tiburtina station itself is not the kind of place you want to go through at 5am either, some shady people hanging around. Also, there must be a club/disco nearby because Saturday night, you could hear the music from the hotel room. We woke up early (for flight) and the music was still playing. If I was going back to Rome, I would not stay in this hotel again, simply because of the unwillingness to help from reception and the bus rides from Tiburtina (ok during day but in evening not so great).

Reviews.Title: “Not for tourists”
Reviews.Author: nickswlon
Reviews.Content: First the positive: The staff were friendly, if a little stressed at times. The price was cheap for Rome - I paid £63 each night. Now the rest: It's not a 4 star hotel as advertised on Lastminute.com and it's nowhere near the centre of Rome so very inconvenient for tourists. Others have said how to get back to the hotel but it's about half an hour to get out from the centre. I didn't like the area - you can't pop out for nightlife once you get back to the hotel. I ate in the hotel restaurant which was very nice but they should have warned me that they put shelfish in the salmon spaghetti - I might have been allergic. The area isn't very appealing. I didn't take a cab to and from the centre but if it costs 17 euros each way, I would prefer to pay 34 euros more each night and get a hotel nearer the centre. And on my final night, there was a penetrating noise all night. I woke up at 3am and couldn't get back to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JJuly
Reviews.Content: Blu Hotel is a hiden Gem. Very nice rooms, helpful stuff, clean. The only disavantage I can think of is the location. You might need to take a bus (3 stops) to the tiburtina rail/metro station which is no a big deal. Blu hotel is excellent value for money choice. I recomend it very strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JandL3000
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome! Located about 5-7 minutes by taxi from Rome Train Station. It was very nicely and stylistically decorated. Room was great. Nice front desk personnel. Prices were just about right. Breakfast is extra. But we did not buy the breakfast package. There are several nice local restaurants in the area. This hotel is great if you want to stay not too far away from the hustle and bustle of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A good base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: Labirb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blu Roma from April 8th until 12th. Our stay was over Easter and that was the reason we choose the Blu Roma - we thought central Rome would be very busy at this time of year. On arrival we were very pleased with our room except for one thing - we had been hoping for a balcony but did not have one in the three bedded room we had booked. This was not a problem as we had big windows that opened wide - a welcome feature as the weather was unexpectedly hot during our stay. The hotel was very clean - in fact our room was cleaned every morning while we were at breakfast! The front counter staff were very helpful on our arrival and talked us through the area. We caught the train straight from the airport to Turbertina for 5,50 euro's - a bargin for the hour's journey. We also got a three day metro pass for 11 euro's to cover our transport into the city. We also spent some time exploring the local area - a five minute walk right out of the hotel takes you to a typical italian piazza in a local area - we were the only tourists there and did not in the least feel unwelcome or uncomfortable - which is unusual when three women are travelling alone. We ate like kings (lots of pizza) for 4 euro's each - a real bargin. Also try the ice-creams from the shopping centre nearby - heavenly! The one thing that we did notice at the hotel on the first night was how quiet it was - apart from ourselves, there appeared to be only 2 other guest staying - until the next morning when we looked out the window and saw 12 police riot vans parked outside! This concerned us slightly until we were told that 50 police officers were staying at the hotel for a nearby conference!! Needless to say we felt very very safe as they spent the next 3 days milling around (with other guests who had by that point turned up). We can honestly say we picked the safest hotel in Rome what with the police presence!! Rome was beautiful also we walked for miles to cover everything - and not as busy as I had expected Easter to be. Make sure you eat at the hotel resturant - a bit pricey but good food. One word of warning - we had not encountered any form of hassling from the italian men that everyone had told us (three women) we would experience. Even our very blonde friend just had interested men smiling at her until our last day. When walking through Turbuntina station to get the metro into the city a man spat at two of us for no apparent reason - maybe it was because we were tourists, maybe it was because we were women, we do not know. It did take the shine off the trip although only for ten minutes!! Stay at the Blu hotel Roma - it is a great hotel and very clean. Breakfast was good too - although maybe think twice before ordering a coke from the bar - at 5 euro's each it was not the cheapest drink we had ever had to say the least!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: cryfreedom57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found a great deal on Expedia at this hotel as part of a flight and hotel package, so we booked it for our honeymoon. We stayed for 9 nights and overall, I was very pleased with Blu Hotel. First off, if you're looking for ambiance, look elsewhere. It's a pretty basic hotel, but still quite nice. The decor was nothing special, but the bathroom was huge (with a tub! So nice when you've been trekking all over the city!), and the room itself was a lot larger than I expected from a European hotel room. Another great feature was the room had a tile floor, not some icky, mildewy carpet that you find in a lot of hotels. We also stayed on the 1st floor (2nd floor to Americans), and had a really fabulous wrap-around porch attached to the room. It was really nice to step outside and watch the city waking up in the morning. The biggest negative about the room was the bed, as it was not the most comfortable. I managed just fine, but it bothered my husband a bit. There's also a bit of noise coming from the hallways sometimes, but nothing too terrible. The doors to the porch kept the street noise out surprisingly well. In the room there's a small TV, but only Italian channels and they're very limited. We'd hoped to have at least the BBC, since it was right after the election and I wanted to stay caught up, but mostly we ended up watching bad 80's cartoons in Italian (Anyone remember Sheera?). There's also a mini-fridge loaded with the typical stuff-- Coke, water, beer, etc. All for a ridiculous price, but it's there if you want it. The hotel breakfast was decent, though nothing terribly special, and overpriced. It's convenient though, since there's little else around that area for food. The restaurant is okay, but again, nothing special. Blu Hotel is kinda far from the metro, so if you're planning on using it as your main means of transportation, be prepared for a 10-15 minute walk crossing a few busy roads. It wasn't that big of an issue for us, but Rome in general requires a lot of walking unless you do one of those bus tours, so having to hike back to the hotel at night isn't so fun. Rome is VERY pedestrian-friendly, so the walk itself isn't terrible. I was also very happy to be able to burn so many calories-- I ate whatever I wanted because we walked so much! The closest station is Tiburtina, on the B line. The hotel staff was a mixed experience. They all spoke English very well, which was a relief since my Italian sucks. The male receptionists were very helpful and knowledgeable, giving us directions to places all over the city. My only complaint was that one of the female receptionists was somewhat rude and seemed to be annoyed whenever we asked a question. Overall, I think Blu is a great place for those on a budget that have plenty of time to see the city. We had a great time. Pros: Clean (thanks to the most fantastic housekeeping staff!), mostly quiet, inexpensive and overall a pleasant experience. Cons: not the most comfortable bed, somewhat far from the metro (but still very do-able to most) General tips: If you're going to be using the metro a lot, buy a pass from one of the tobacco shops in the station. We used a machine once, and it ate 30 Euros worth of bills. Not so fun. Save yourself the hassle. Also, Termini station is great for stopping for a quick bite to eat. There's a grocery store on the metro level, and we bought take-away meals and brought them back to the hotel for dinner. Saved us a lot of money-- 3.50 Euros for lasagna! There's also a bunch of fast food places (both ground level and metro level) and a Boulangerie (bakery) that has really great pizza (ground level, on the far end opening up to the street). The best food of the city is to be found at small, take-away shops, so skip the sit-down restaurants and go to the tiny, busy local haunts. You'll be happy you did.

Reviews.Title: “For the money this is the best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Buckeye96
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were pleasantly surprised upon arriving at the Blu Hotel Roma. The hotel was freshly renovated and the service was fantastic. Our room was large and spacious and our bathroom was clean and modern. The breakfast buffet, which came included in the price, was top notch. This hotel is located a little bit away from downtown Rome but getting back and forth on public transportation was a piece of cake. A bus stop is located just outside the hotel and it is only a 5 minute bus ride to the metro station. On the down side, the hotel does not have room service. On a couple of occassions, I walked to a local pizzeria to buy some food for takeout (it was hot out and our room had great air-conditioning). The reception told me that customers were not allowed to eat in the rooms - period. I told her that I had never stayed in a hotel before that didn't allow food to be eaten in the room. Unbelievable! The cable TV service included only 1 English channel (BBC) which is about as much fun as watching paint dry. No FOX news! Oh well...Rome is not a place to spend your time inside watching TV. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel and will return the next time we visit Rome. It takes a little bit of time getting to and from the center but for the price you won't find a nicer hotel anywhere in Rome. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but In Da Ghetto”
Reviews.Author: kittenx1983
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice, clean, well furnished and pleasant exterior, but wht it is in that location I will never know. The hotel was reasonable price, but it cost us a fortune in taxis and tubes. The taxi ride was at least 20mins to the centre and cost 17 euros one night to trevi fountains. We spent more on transport than we would've for five star in centre!! The area its in is very sub-urban, graffiti everywhere and looks like the Rome ghetto. You have to get a bus to station, then tube to centre, at night we got a taxi there and back as didn't fancy sweaty public transport at night. The information is mis-leading abnout this hotel's location. 2km to Colosium?? No way!! Great hotel but location terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: therockfairy
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, but the location wasnt as near - but for the price you pay its was excellent - very clean (could see your face in the floor!) the breakfeast was very nice. Staff very friendly especially one guy called Daniel who told us everything we needed to know. All airconditioned and minibar, hairdryer and anything you want just ask the staff who were very friendly The location is slightly out from the centre - not a short walk from the station- but the 409 bus leaves every 5-10 mins and goes to Tiburtina - which is a main bus and train station, with loads of buses and trains/metro - not much of a nightlife near the hotel - but the transport links are so good - the buses run til midnight and then theres a nightbus - also plenty of cab numbers which you can get from the hotel reception. However coz there is not much nightlife, it is very quiet so no worries of outside noise or hassle. a little TIP: instead of getting the Leonardo express train from the Airport - get a TrenItalie train to Tiburtina - takes 45 mins and cost about 4euros each (instead of 11euros for the leonardo express) - the bus 71 leaves from tirbutina and goes to the centre of the city in 35 mins or so! Overall very good and worth the money - definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, No nightlife or eat-outs”
Reviews.Author: kavyagopi
Reviews.Content: The hotel delivered what it promised. It felt like the 4* that it said. Good service , helpful staff. Though websites said hotel was 400m away from the Tiburtina station, we took a bus to hotel from station evry time. It was n't a short walk and had no good view worth walking. But the station was close. Tiburtina station has frequent services to places like Venice /Pisa/Florence , that helps if you plan to visit these places while in Rome. But there are no eat-outs around or any nightlife for party animals.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: pscoyotes
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we were a group of five people and they had the most affordable accommodation with their family room. It worked great because my husband and I were traveling with our teenager daughters. The family room is just 2 rooms that also share a common door, so you can close the common door and leave the room doors open. Plus there were 2 baths which is a major plus with teenage girls!! Basically we used this room for 2 nights just as a place to sleep. We would leave after breakfast and spend most of the day sightseeing returning to the hotel to get ready for dinner and sleep. It is a good walk to the train station. I can see it being a bit much for some people especially if you made several trips a day. The negatives: Some of the staff were very pleasant and others not so much. The electricity did go out while we were there, but the staff was very quick to fix the problem and it was only out for about 20 minutes. The internet was not working during our stay which was disappointing as my husband needed it for his work. My daughters did see a scorpion in the hallway one morning, but we never saw any in our rooms or any other little creatures. If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel and do not mind the long walk to the train station (you can take a bus instead) and the nonattentive staff this will be a good choice for you. It met our needs and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “New, Clean and Close to Public Transit”
Reviews.Author: ckcarr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very new and up to date, although it seems that it has been open for a few years we saw that not all the rooms are finished. Our room was very new and very nice and had a patio but no patio furniture and one chair in the whole room, but it was way to hot to sit out on the patio in Rome anyway. The breakfast was ok, nothing spectacular. The vast majority of the front desk staff speak English but often it seemed like they are inconvenienced to speak English to you. They were definitely not the nicest of people but not the worst either and didn’t make any extra effort to help you enjoy your stay in Rome. There was a bus stop about 2 minutes away from the hotel that took you directly to the metro station. The metro consists of 2 lines, unlike Paris that had at least a dozen if not more. If you request a larger bed they simply push together two single beds and put a larger sheet and blanket on top. Overall it was very new, clean and had pretty nice rooms but the staff weren’t the best we’ve experienced. They do have internet access in the lobby but you have to pay by the hour. Overall the stay was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Americans”
Reviews.Author: ScooterPaPa
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel have absolutely no concept of how nor desire to provide even rudimentary service to their guests. Simple service assistance like helping with luggage, providing advice on where to eat, how and where to exchange money, help with taxis or tour scheduling, etc were accomplished only when I persisted with the front desk, and even then it was if the staff were doing you a huge favor by even speaking to you, much less providing advice or making a phone call on your behalf. Bottom line, this is not an "ugly American" thing, I made no unreasonable requests or demands , nor was I rude or obnoxious. This is just not a friendly place to stay for Americans who are used to at least some semblance of service at even the most remote and out of the way hotels. Save your money, stay in a higher rated, more expensive hotel with a better reputation for service. Don't waste time and money at the Blu Hotel Roma, they don't seem to want or need your business.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: RattyUK
Reviews.Content: I kind of agree with the previous review. Although 4 stars, there were small things that you woudnt expect from a 4 star hotel, such as plastic disposable cups in the rooms etc. That said, it was very clean and the staff were helpful and polite. At the end of the day, you get what you pay for, so if you dont want to fork out a lot for a hotel in the city itself, then the blu hotel roma is fine. If you go out in the city at night, a taxi home after midnight will cost you about 15 euros from Piazza navona.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of ripped off.”
Reviews.Author: None_6565
Reviews.Content: It was very difficult to fin an hotel in Rome that provided hard wired internet access in the guest rooms, which my husband and I need for work reasons. When we finally found the Blu Hotel Roma, we called to confirm that there was internet access available and they told us there is, but at around 6.00 Euro per hour or that we could upgrade to a Business Rome for 40.00 Euro per night and have unlimited internet access, among other things such as free newspaper and free access to the frigobar. it was of main importance that we would have internet, so we took the room "Business Room". Our surprise when we arrived to the hotel was that for accessing internet, they would give us some kind of ticket with a login and password valid for one hour. In our case, as it was unlimited, we would as for 24 tickets a day and no problem, but internet access would be interrupted every 60 minutes and then you had to login and password again, and again and again. This is absolutely not what we call "unlimited internet access" (and to think we paid 40.00 Euro extra PER NIGHT!). They have told us that we would have "free newspaper", but is not as in the USA when you have the newspaper at the door of room every morning, there was a pile with two local newspaper at the entrance and you could take them, but that was all. On their website and depliants it says "satellite TV". There were only around 10 channles, 8 of which were local italian channels, BBK News and a News channel in Arab. That's it for "satellite TV". Also on their website it says that the hotel is at 400 mts. distance from the nearest local subway station which may be true is you draw a straight line on a map. But going up and down through those narrow streets took us around 25-30 minutes walking briskly. On the brighter side we were very plesed with the breakfast served (ham, fresh bread, eggs, etc. ) and the nice ladies who work there and brought nice fresh capuccino to our table.:-) Overall the hotel is clean and new but not cheap, and adding what we paid for extra services that weren't worth, we feel kind of ripped off. Oh! And another detail that annoyed us: we booked around 1 1/2 month before our trip, at a certain price being assured that it was the cheapest fare (directly with the hotel) a week before we found that the same room was offered at a much lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Desk Help”
Reviews.Author: MrMoparIdaho
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Blu Roma in March 2006. The hotel is located in an acceptable part of town about 1/2 mile from a major subway terminal. You can also ride a number of buses from the terminal to the hotel. The front of the building is nothing special but the lobby is attractive. Our room was quite large and the bathroom was gigantic compared to the other hotels I've stayed at in Europe. Everything was clean and well maintained. The best part of the hotel was the hotel desk staff. In particular on of the gentlemen went out of his way to help me find some of the local attractions. His english was excellent and his attitude was wonderful. I wish some of the hotel staffs in the US would take note! My only issue with the hotel was noise. Our room was on the first floor near the elevator. With lovely tile floors throughout, we were awakened numerous times by other hotel guests coming back after "painting the town". But other than the noise, we were satisfied with hotel. We also found the best waiter and food a few blocks away at "La Boheme", but that's for another review.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel, too far away from city center”
Reviews.Author: Bul
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more convenient for business people. we just wanted to visit the city rome. only if you have a car, and if you didn't find another hotel in the city center it is ok to stay here, otherwise it takes you 45 min to get to the city center. Before travelling we were afraid of not finding any parking place in the city center. But now we now, that it is very easy to find a parking place everywhere, because in rome everybody parks everywhere :))

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value, reasonably convenient location”
Reviews.Author: nmgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here on a business trip in September, after I booked it for him based on previous reviews both here and on venere (where I did the booking online). He was very impressed with the hotel. It is new and clean, and the rate (EUR99/night) was very reasonable. It is close to Tiburtina station, which has a shuttle directly to the airport. As others have commented, it is difficult to find on foot; be sure to print out a detailed street map (not just the ones on the booking site).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - especially with a car.”
Reviews.Author: BadDrachenfels
Reviews.Content: Stayed in June 2005. This Hotel is an excellent value. Very clean, air-conditioned, decent breakfast, nice staff. However, it is not as easy to find or get to as descried in the other reviews. For most people, the walk to the hotel would be considered long. A good half mile or about 1 KM. There are two buses from the north train station to the hotel. You get tickets at the bus station in the back of the train station. Coming from the hotel to the train station, you have to buy them in the bar across the street located Kati-Korner from the hotel. Crossing to the hotel can be difficult from the bar depending on the hour due to traffic. Area appeared safe and I walked it with my daughter inthe day and later at night. But it is kind of quiet late so i would recommend a cab after 11 PM unless you are a group. There is a Pizza palce down the street from the hotel on the way to the station that is quite popular. The Bar also serves food across the street from the hotel and is also popular. Rome subway/u-bahn stops running real early like 9PM There is a bus to the train station until almost midnight from downtown and then you take another bus to the hotel. Train ride is 20 minutes. Bus ride a half hour from downtown. Call hotel for bus numbers. Finding hotel from station. There are no signs or info in station. Go out the side where the buses are and walk up the hill on the left past some industrial buildings. Make a left on the overpass. Walk to light and make a right crossing the street to the newspaper stand. There is a sign for the hotel on the corner if you look for it. You walk straight down an industrial street and hotel is a ways down on the right. You pass the bus repair depot and a gas station. Very modern hotel. Everything is new. They have secure parking as well. If you are driving, this is the place. Easy access from highway and I think parking is free,. I paid about 103 euros a night and it was well worth it and cheaper than any other hotel I found. Every bit as nice as a Radisson and a better value. Windows open and it is quiet. Place is spotless. Hotel is non-smoking everywhere. Security excellent.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT NEW HOTEL, CLEAN, ENGLISH SPOKEN”
Reviews.Author: belizeLady
Reviews.Content: Hi, I am female New Yorker from Jamicia Queens just got back from Rome, Italy on May 1st of 2005. Had a wonderful time and would go back again, my hotel was Blu Hotel, 5 Largo Domencico 5 Rome --- for located not in the center of Rome, but 2 stops away from the Turbini Station on the B line and 4 stops away from Termini which is a centre located area. The hotel is clean very new, good service, mini bar in room, balcony rooms, great breadfast, consisting of the usuall, eggs, cheese, danish, yougurt, rolls, ceral, juices, coffee, tea, ect. Staff speaks english and very help ful. The only problem I had was with getting messages from the front desk, always said I did not have any messages but in fact I did. My room was room 232, from April 21-May1. If you are arriving from FCO airport the taxi fare should be only betw E55 to E60's, but you can take the train from the airport to the Hotel, the F1 is about 5 euros and get off at the Turbini station, and take the 409 bus or the 595 bus to the hotel its like 5 to 6 minutes, the stop is right front of the hotel, The hotel is face inside a paking area so you really have to pay attention at 1st for you do see the Blu sign and its gated in. The metro fare is 1 Euro for 75minutes once you validate your card at the turnstyle. Their are a few clubs in walking distance, and a pub/bar. Also in the hotel lobby is a bar. From the hotel you can walk 5 to 8 minutes to the Turbini station, and take the train again 4 stops to Termini and from their follow your guide. This hotel is affordable and very clean. But again not centre but can get to the Centre. BUT BUT BUT PLEASE PLEASE WATCH YOUR POCKETS, THEY PICK POCKET HERE LIKE ITS GOING OUT OF STYLE. It did not happend to me they tried but I am from NY so I refuse to let that happedn to me. But watch out for this. It is very easy to get from city to city, the information booth is in each station, if you are going over to the next city its better to find out the schudule for the train the day before. You can take the IC train which is the local, like 11/2 hours later arrival than the EuroStar. The IC is cheaper than the Eurostar but go to the same places. from Rome to Naples is 3 hours on the IC, and from Florence to Veneice is 31/2hours Eurostar. from Rome to Pomeii is 21/2 or 3 hours I forgot but not long nice ride very interesting and historical in the Old Pomeii. Where comfortable shoe please for the entire trip. We had beautiful wheather the whole time. Well I hope this helps I know its long, but I am trying to give whatever I learned to others. I am not expert just what I learned. Hope this helps. LADY THAT LIVES IN QUEENS, NY FROM BELIZE CITY. Desiree.Dixon@us.HSBC.com
